name: Chartjs.Chart

unions.name: Type
unions.comment:
Basic type for a Chart

For charts containing multiple datasets, both a chart type needs to specified
and a type for each dataset. Default Chart.js parameters will inherit from this type.

aliases.name: Chart
aliases.comment:
Main type helper for a Chartjs chart

Both a Data and an Options object must be specified to help configure this chart.
aliases.type: { chartType : Chartjs.Chart.Type, data : Chartjs.Data.Data, options : Chartjs.Options.Options }

values.name: chart
values.comment:
Given attributes and a chart, creates an HTML node using the web component

ChartJs is smart enough to figure out scaling naturally
To set the size of the chart, use CSS styles (either in a stylesheet or using the attributes)

values.name: defaultChart
values.comment: Given a chart type, creates a default chart that can then be updated.

values.name: setData
values.comment: Update the data for a chart.

values.name: setOptions
values.comment: Update the options for a chart.

name: Chartjs.Common
comment:
Common types used for various configuration properties

@docs PointStyle, LineCap, LineJoin, Position, PointProperty

unions.name: PointProperty
unions.comment:
Many properties that apply to datasets
can either be applied to the whole dataset, or to each individual point

For applying a property to every point in the dataset, use the All type
For using a list of properties on a per-point basis, use the PerPoint type

unions.name: Position
unions.comment: Positioning often used in options such as axes and legends

name: Chartjs.Data

unions.name: DataSet
unions.comment:
Type wrapper for an individual dataset

While this type should match the overall chart type,
it is possible to put multiple types of dataset on one chart

aliases.name: Data
aliases.comment:
All datasets for a chart are contained in a single Data object
This also specifies the category labels, which are shared across datasets
(eg. multiple bar charts with the same categories)
aliases.type: { labels : List.List String.String, datasets : List.List Chartjs.Data.DataSet }

values.name: addDataset
values.comment:
Add a dataset to a Data object
This is very useful for use with the |> operator

    defaultData
        |> addDataset dataset1
        |> addDataset dataset2

values.name: buildData
values.comment: Build a Data object from a list of labels and a list of datasets

values.name: dataFromLabels
values.comment: Data object with specified labels but no datasets

values.name: defaultData
values.comment: Data object with no labels or datasets defined

name: Chartjs.DataSets.Bar

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/bar.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

    defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
        |> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
        |> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, xAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, yAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), borderSkipped : Maybe.Maybe String.String, hoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float) }

values.name: defaultBarFromData
values.comment: Create a Bar dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultBarFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Bar dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the bar

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the bar

values.name: setBorderSkipped
values.comment:
Which edge to skip drawing border for
One of: 'bottom' 'left' 'top' 'right'

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Stroke width of the bar in pixels

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as a bar

values.name: setHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the bar when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the bar when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width of the bar when hovered

values.name: setXAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the X axis to plot the dataset on

values.name: setYAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the Y axis to plot the dataset on

name: Chartjs.DataSets.DoughnutAndPie

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/doughnut.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
|> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
|> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderAlign : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), hoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float) }

values.name: defaultPieFromData
values.comment: Create a Pie dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultPieFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Pie dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the arcs

values.name: setBorderAlign
values.comment:
Whether the borders of each arc should overlap or not
Set to 'center' to overlap
Set to 'inner' to not overlap

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Color of the border

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as an arc

values.name: setHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the arcs when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the arcs when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border when hovered

name: Chartjs.DataSets.Line

unions.name: FillBoundary
unions.comment:
Which boundary to use when using FillBoundary
Can be the scale origin, start, or end

unions.name: FillMode
unions.comment:
FIll modes handle how area charts should be displayed
Can be:

  - an absolute dataset index
  - a relative dataset index
  - between the dataset and the boundaries

unions.name: SteppedLine
unions.comment:
Step Interpolation for lines

BeforeInterpolation: Step-before Interpolation
AfterInterpolation: Step-after Interpolation

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/line.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
|> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
|> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
|> setBorderCapStyle "round"
|> setFill Disabled
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, xAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, yAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), borderDash : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), borderDashOffset : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, borderCapStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderJoinStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, cubicInterpolationMode : Maybe.Maybe String.String, fill : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.DataSets.Line.FillMode, lineTension : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, pointBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointStyle : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Chartjs.Common.PointStyle), pointRotation : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHitRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointHoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointHoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHoverRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), showLine : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, spanGaps : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, steppedLine : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.DataSets.Line.SteppedLine }

values.name: defaultLineFromData
values.comment: Create a Line dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultLineFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Line dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment:
Fill color of the area under the bar
Applies for area charts

values.name: setBorderCapStyle
values.comment: Cap style of the line

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Color of the line

values.name: setBorderDash
values.comment: Length and spacing of line dashes

values.name: setBorderDashOffset
values.comment: Offset for line dashes

values.name: setBorderJoinStyle
values.comment: Joint style of the line

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Line width (in pixels)

values.name: setCubicInterpolationMode
values.comment:
Which cubic interpolation mode to use
'default' uses a weighted cubic interpolation
'monotone' is better at preserving monotonicity

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as a point on the line

values.name: setFill
values.comment: How to fill the area under the line

values.name: setLineTension
values.comment:
Beizer curve tension
0 is straight lines

This option is ignored if cubicInterpolation is set to 'monotone'

values.name: setPointBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color for points

values.name: setPointBorderColor
values.comment: Border color for points

values.name: setPointBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width (in pixels) for points

values.name: setPointHitRadius
values.comment: Hit radius for point interactivity

values.name: setPointHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverRadius
values.comment: Radius for points when hovered

values.name: setPointRadius
values.comment: Radius of the point shape

values.name: setPointRotation
values.comment: Rotation of the point (in degrees)

values.name: setPointStyle
values.comment: Style of the point

values.name: setShowLine
values.comment: Whether the line for this dataset should be drawn

values.name: setSpanGaps
values.comment: Whether points with no data should be filled in or not

values.name: setSteppedLine
values.comment:
Set the step interpolation for the line

If set to anything other than false, lineTension will be ignored

values.name: setXAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the X axis to plot this dataset on

values.name: setYAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the Y axis to plot this dataset on

Whether the borders of each segment should overlap or not
Set to 'center' to overlap
Set to 'inner' to not overlap

values.comment: Color of the border

Set the data displayed by this dataset

name: Chartjs.Options

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment: These options are applied to the whole chart and not an individual dataset
aliases.type: { animations : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Animations.Animations, layout : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Layout.Layout, legend : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Legend.Legend, title : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Title.Title, tooltips : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Tooltips.Tooltips, elements : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Elements, scales : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Scales.Scales, maintainAspectRatio : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, responsive : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Creates a blank options structure which can then be edited using the below set functions

values.name: setAnimations
values.comment: Set the animations property

values.name: setElements
values.comment: Set the elements property

values.name: setLayout
values.comment: Set the layout property

values.name: setLegend
values.comment: Set the legend property

values.name: setMaintainAspectRatio
values.comment: Set whether to keep the aspect ratio of this chart consistent

values.name: setResponsive
values.comment:
Set whether this chart should be responsive
Note: there is currently no parameters to directly set the width and hieght of the chart
I strongly recommend sizing the parent web component and leaving this option enabled

values.name: setScales
values.comment: Set the scales property

values.name: setTitle
values.comment: Set the title property

values.name: setTooltips
values.comment: Set the tootlips property

name: Chartjs.Options.Animations

unions.name: Easing
unions.comment:
Different easings for animations
To see examples of these easings, see <https://easings.net>

aliases.name: Animations
aliases.type: { duration : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, easing : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Animations.Easing, animateRotate : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, animateScale : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

values.name: setAnimateRotate
values.comment: Used for Pie charts

values.name: setAnimateScale
values.comment: Used for Pie charts

values.name: setDuration
values.comment: Time (in milliseconds) an animation takes

values.name: setEasing
values.comment: Easing function to use

name: Chartjs.Options.Elements
comment:
While there is ways to configure the styling of each dataset, sometimes you want custom styles applied to all datasets
For more information, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/configuration/elements.html>

Please note that this module does not have updater functions and you will need to use record update syntax if using this functionality

@docs Elements, defaultElements, Point, defaultPoint, Line, LineFill, Rectangle, Arc

aliases.name: Arc
aliases.type: { backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

aliases.name: Elements
aliases.type: { point : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Point, line : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Line, rectangle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Rectangle, arc : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Arc }

aliases.name: Line
aliases.type: { tension : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderCapStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.LineCap, borderDash : Maybe.Maybe (List.List Basics.Int), borderDashOffset : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderJoinStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.LineJoin, capBezierPoints : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, fill : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.LineFill, stepped : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

aliases.name: Point
aliases.type: { radius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, pointStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.PointStyle, rotation : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, hitRadius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, hoverRadius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

aliases.name: Rectangle
aliases.type: { backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderSkipped : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position }

unions.name: Layout
unions.comment:
Controls the amount of padding inside the chart
By default, this is 0 on all sides

This can be set as either Uniform (applied to all sides)
or Specific (different paddings for each side)
cases: { left : Basics.Int, right : Basics.Int, top : Basics.Int, bottom : Basics.Int }

name: Chartjs.Options.Legend

aliases.name: Labels
aliases.comment: Properties for the labels that make up the legend
aliases.type: { boxWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, fontSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, fontStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, fontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, fontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, usePointStyle : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

aliases.name: Legend
aliases.comment: The chart legend displays data about the datasets that are appearing on the chart
aliases.type: { display : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, fullWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, reverse : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, labels : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Legend.Labels }

values.name: defaultLabels
values.comment: Create a blank labels object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: defaultLegend
values.comment: Create a blank legend object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: setBoxWidth
values.comment: Width of the coloured box

values.name: setDisplay
values.comment: Is the legend shown?

values.name: setFontColor
values.comment: Color of the label text

values.name: setFontFamily
values.comment: Font family to use for label text

values.name: setFontSize
values.comment: Font size of the label text

values.name: setFontStyle
values.comment: Font style of the label text (normal, bold, etc.)

values.name: setFullWidth
values.comment:
Marks that this box should take the full width of the canvas (pushing down other boxes).
This is unlikely to need to be changed in day-to-day use.

values.name: setLabels
values.comment: Set properties for the labels of this legend

values.name: setPadding
values.comment: Padding between rows of coloured boxes

values.name: setPosition
values.comment: Position of the legend (relative to the chart)

values.name: setReverse
values.comment: Legend will show datasets in reverse order

values.name: setUsePointStyle
values.comment: Label style will match corresponding point style

name: Chartjs.Options.Scales

aliases.name: Axis
aliases.comment: A single axis for a chart
aliases.type: { position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, stacked : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, ticks : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Scales.Ticks, gridLines : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Scales.GridLines }

aliases.name: GridLines
aliases.comment:
Create an empty grid lines object
For more information, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/axes/styling.html#grid-line-configuration>
aliases.type: { display : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, color : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color) }

aliases.name: Scales
aliases.comment: Container for all axes of a chart
aliases.type: { xAxes : List.List Chartjs.Options.Scales.Axis, yAxes : List.List Chartjs.Options.Scales.Axis }

aliases.name: Ticks
aliases.comment:
Type structure for a single axes
This currently only supports standard linear Cartesian axes.

For more information, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/axes/cartesian/>
aliases.type: { fontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, callback : Maybe.Maybe String.String, beginAtZero : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, min : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, max : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, maxTicksLimit : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, precision : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, stepSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, suggestedMax : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, suggestedMin : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, fontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color }

values.comment: Create an empty axis object

values.comment: Create an empty ticks object

values.name: scalesFromAxes
values.comment: Build a scales object from a list of axes

values.name: setBeginAtZero
values.comment: If true, scale will include 0 (if it is not already included)

values.name: setColor
values.comment: Color to use for grid lines

values.name: setDisplay
values.comment: Whether grid lines should be displayed

values.name: setFontColor
values.comment: Font color to use for ticks

values.name: setFontFamily
values.comment: Font family to use for ticks

values.name: setGridLines
values.comment: Grid line configuration

values.name: setMax
values.comment:
Defined maximum value,
overrides value from data

values.name: setMaxTicksLimit
values.comment: Maximum number of ticks and grid lines to show

values.name: setMin
values.comment:
Defined minimum value,
overrides value from data

values.name: setPosition
values.comment: Position of the axis in the chart

values.name: setPrecision
values.comment:
If defined and stepSize is not specified,
then the step size will be rounded to this many decimal places

values.name: setStepSize
values.comment: Set a defined fixed step size for the scale

values.name: setSuggestedMax
values.comment: Adjustment used when calculating the maximum data value

values.name: setSuggestedMin
values.comment: Adjust used when calculating the minimum data value

values.name: setTicks
values.comment: Tick configuration

name: Chartjs.Options.Title

aliases.name: Title
aliases.comment: The Title is text that is drawn outside of the Chart
aliases.type: { display : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, fontSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, fontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, fontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, fontStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, lineHeight : Maybe.Maybe String.String, text : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

Font style for the title text
eg. normal, bold, italic

Height of each individual line of text

name: Chartjs.Options.Tooltips

unions.name: Mode
unions.comment:
Controls what elements are displayed in the tooltip
Point: finds all items that intersect the point
Nearest: gets the items that are at the nearest distance to the point
Index: finds item at the same index
X: find all items that interesct (based on X axis only)
Y: find all items that intersect (based on Y axis only)

unions.name: PositionMode
unions.comment:
Positioning mode for tooltips

Average will place the tooltip at the average position of the displayed items
Nearest will place the tooltip at the element closest to the event position

aliases.name: Callbacks
aliases.type: { label : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

aliases.name: Tooltips
aliases.comment: Tooltips are displayed when interacting with charts

values.comment: Currently unsupported!
